name: Field
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Schema
Field
description:
Schema Field

The fields of a table schema.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
table = dataset.table "my_table"

field = table.schema.field "name"
field.required? #=> true

methods.name: name
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Schema
Field#name
methods.description: The name of the field.

returns.description:
The field name. The name must contain only
letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), or underscores (_), and must
start with a letter or underscore. The maximum length is 128
characters.

methods.name: name=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Schema
Field#name=
methods.description: Updates the name of the field.

params.name: new_name
params.description:
The field name. The name must contain only
letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), or underscores (_), and must
start with a letter or underscore. The maximum length is 128
characters.

methods.name: type
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Schema
Field#type
methods.description: The data type of the field.

returns.description: The field data type. Possible values include STRING, BYTES, INTEGER, INT64 (same as INTEGER), FLOAT, FLOAT64 (same as FLOAT), BOOLEAN, BOOL (same as BOOLEAN), TIMESTAMP, DATE, TIME, DATETIME, RECORD (where RECORD indicates that the field contains a nested schema) or STRUCT (same as RECORD).

methods.name: type=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Schema
Field#type=
methods.description: Updates the data type of the field.

params.name: new_type
params.description: The data type. Possible values include STRING, BYTES, INTEGER, INT64 (same as INTEGER), FLOAT, FLOAT64 (same as FLOAT), BOOLEAN, BOOL (same as BOOLEAN), TIMESTAMP, DATE, TIME, DATETIME, RECORD (where RECORD indicates that the field contains a nested schema) or STRUCT (same as RECORD).

methods.name: fields
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Schema
Field#fields
methods.description: The nested fields if the type property is set to RECORD. Will be empty otherwise.

returns.description: The nested schema fields if the type is set to RECORD.

methods.name: headers
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Schema
Field#headers
methods.description: The names of the nested fields as symbols if the type property is set to RECORD. Will be empty otherwise.

returns.description: The names of the nested schema fields if the type is set to RECORD.

methods.name: field
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Schema
Field#field
methods.description: Retrieve a nested field by name, if the type property is set to RECORD. Will return nil otherwise.

returns.description: The nested schema field object, or nil.

methods.name: string
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Schema
Field#string
methods.description:
Adds a string field to the nested schema of a record field.

This can only be called on fields that are of type RECORD.

params.name: name
params.description:
The field name. The name must contain only
letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), or underscores (_), and must
start with a letter or underscore. The maximum length is 128
characters.

params.name: description
params.description: A description of the field.

params.name: mode
params.description: The field’s mode. The possible values are :nullable, :required, and :repeated. The default value is :nullable.

methods.name: record
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Schema
Field#record
methods.description:
Adds a record field to the nested schema of a record field. A block must be passed describing the nested fields of the record. For more information about nested and repeated records, see Preparing Data for BigQuery.

This can only be called on fields that are of type RECORD.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
table = dataset.create_table "my_table"

table.schema do |schema|
  schema.string "first_name", mode: :required
  schema.record "cities_lived", mode: :repeated do |cities_lived|
    cities_lived.record "city", mode: :required do |city|
      city.string "name", mode: :required
      city.string "country", mode: :required
    end
    cities_lived.integer "number_of_years", mode: :required
  end
end

params.name: name
params.description:
The field name. The name must contain only
letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), or underscores (_), and must
start with a letter or underscore. The maximum length is 128
characters.

params.name: description
params.description: A description of the field.

params.name: mode
params.description: The field’s mode. The possible values are :nullable, :required, and :repeated. The default value is :nullable.

params.name: yield
params.description: a block for setting the nested schema

params.name: yield.nested_schema
params.description:
the object accepting the
nested schema
